study.description: A Study is a container for a sequencing investigation that may comprise multiple experiments. The Study has an overall goal, but is otherwise minimally defined in the SRA.  A Study is composed of a descriptor, zero or more experiments, and zero or more analyses. The submitter may decorate the Study with web links and properties.

fields.name: alias
fields.description: Unique identificator for a study. This is used to link experiments to the study.

fields.name: title
fields.description: Title of the study as would be used in a publication.

fields.name: study_type
fields.description: The STUDY_TYPE presents a controlled vocabulary for expressing the overall purpose of the study.

fields.name: new_study_type
fields.description: Optional if 'study_type' is not 'other'To propose a new term, select Other and enter a new study type.

fields.name: study_abstract
fields.description: Briefly describes the goals, purpose, and scope of the Study.  This need not be listed if it can be inherited from a referenced publication.

experiment.description: An experiment object serves as a metadata record encapsulating essential details about a sequencing experiment, including the experimental design, sequencing type, and relevant parameters. This information enhances the interpretation and contextual understanding of nucleotide sequences submitted to the archive.

fields.name: alias
fields.description: Unique identificator for each experiment. This is used to link runs to experiments.

fields.name: title
fields.description: Short text that can be used to call out experiment records in searches or in displays. This element is technically optional but should be used for all new records.

fields.name: study_alias
fields.description: Identifies the parent study. (From study metadata)

fields.name: sample_alias
fields.description: (From sample metadata)

fields.name: design_description
fields.description: Goal and setup of the individual library including library was constructed.

fields.name: library_name
fields.description: The submitter's name for this library.

fields.name: library_strategy
fields.description: Sequencing technique intended for this library.

fields.name: library_source
fields.description: The LIBRARY_SOURCE specifies the type of source material that is being sequenced.

fields.name: library_selection
fields.description: Method used to enrich the target in the sequence library preparation

fields.name: library_layout
fields.description: LIBRARY_LAYOUT specifies whether to expect single, paired, or other configuration of reads. In the case of paired reads, information about the relative distance and orientation is specified.

fields.name: insert_size
fields.description: Insert size for paired reads

fields.name: library_construction_protocol
fields.description: Free form text describing the protocol by which the sequencing library was constructed.

fields.name: platform
fields.description: The PLATFORM record selects which sequencing platform and platform-specific runtime parameters. This will be determined by the Center. optional if 'instrument_model' is provided.

fields.name: instrument_model
fields.description: Model of the sequencing instrument.

run.description: A run contains a group of reads generated for a particular experiment.

fields.name: alias
fields.description: Unique identificator for each run.

fields.name: experiment_alias
fields.description: From_experiment_metadata

fields.name: file_name
fields.description: The name or relative pathname of a run data file.

fields.name: file_format
fields.description: The run data file model.

sample.description: A Sample defines an isolate of sequenceable material upon which sequencing experiments can be based.  The Sample object may be a surrogate for taxonomy accession or an anonymized individual identifier.  Or, it may fully specify provenance and isolation method of the starting material.

fields.name: alias
fields.description: Unique identificator for each run.

fields.name: title
fields.description: Short text that can be used to call out sample records in search results or in displays.

fields.name: taxon_id
fields.description: NCBI Taxonomy Identifier.  This is appropriate for individual organisms and some environmental samples.

fields.name: sample_description
fields.description: Free-form text describing the sample, its origin, and its method of isolation.

fields.name: project name
fields.description: Name of the project within which the sequencing was organized

fields.name: experimental factor
fields.description: Experimental factors are essentially the variable aspects of an experiment design which can be used to describe an experiment, or set of experiments, in an increasingly detailed manner. This field accepts ontology terms from Experimental Factor Ontology (EFO) and/or Ontology for Biomedical Investigations (OBI). For a browser of EFO (v 2.95) terms, please see http://purl.bioontology.org/ontology/EFO; for a browser of OBI (v 2018-02-12) terms please see http://purl.bioontology.org/ontology/OBI. E.g. time series design [EFO:EFO_0001779]

fields.name: ploidy
fields.description: The ploidy level of the genome (e.g. allopolyploid, haploid, diploid, triploid, tetraploid). It has implications for the downstream study of duplicated gene and regions of the genomes (and perhaps for difficulties in assembly). For terms, please select terms listed under class ploidy (PATO:001374) of Phenotypic Quality Ontology (PATO), and for a browser of PATO (v 2018-03-27) please refer to http://purl.bioontology.org/ontology/PATO

fields.name: number of replicons
fields.description: Reports the number of replicons in a nuclear genome of eukaryotes, in the genome of a bacterium or archaea or the number of segments in a segmented virus. Always applied to the haploid chromosome count of a eukaryote. Mandatory for MIGS of eukaryotes, bacteria, archaea and segmented virus.

fields.name: extrachromosomal elements
fields.description: Do plasmids exist of significant phenotypic consequence (e.g. ones that determine virulence or antibiotic resistance). Megaplasmids? Other plasmids (borrelia has 15+ plasmids).

fields.name: estimated size
fields.description: The estimated size of the genome (in bp) prior to sequencing. Of particular importance in the sequencing of (eukaryotic) genome which could remain in draft form for a long or unspecified period. Mandatory for MIGS of eukaryotes.

fields.name: reference for biomaterial
fields.description: Primary publication if isolated before genome publication; otherwise, primary genome report. Mandatory for MIGS of bacteria and archaea.

fields.name: annotation source
fields.description: For cases where annotation was provided by a community jamboree or model organism database rather than by a specific submitter

fields.name: sample volume or weight for DNA extraction
fields.description: Volume (ml) or mass (g) of total collected sample processed for DNA extraction. Note: total sample collected should be entered under the term 'sample size'.

fields.name: nucleic acid extraction
fields.description: A link to a literature reference, electronic resource or a standard operating procedure (SOP), that describes the material separation to recover the nucleic acid fraction from a sample

fields.name: nucleic acid amplification
fields.description: A link to a literature reference, electronic resource or a standard operating procedure (SOP), that describes the enzymatic amplification (PCR, TMA, NASBA) of specific nucleic acids

fields.name: library size
fields.description: Total number of clones in the library prepared for the project

fields.name: library reads sequenced
fields.description: Total number of clones sequenced from the library

fields.name: library construction method
fields.description: Library construction method used for clone libraries

fields.name: library vector
fields.description: Cloning vector type(s) used in construction of libraries

fields.name: library screening strategy
fields.description: Specific enrichment or screening methods applied before and/or after creating clone libraries in order to select a specific group of sequences

fields.name: target gene
fields.description: Targeted gene or locus name for marker gene studies

fields.name: target subfragment
fields.description: Name of subfragment of a gene or locus. Important to e.g. identify special regions on marker genes like V6 on 16S rRNA

fields.name: pcr primers
fields.description: PCR primers that were used to amplify the sequence of the targeted gene, locus or subfragment. This field should contain all the primers used for a single PCR reaction if multiple forward or reverse primers are present in a single PCR reaction. The primer sequence should be reported in uppercase letters

fields.name: multiplex identifiers
fields.description: Molecular barcodes, called Multiplex Identifiers (MIDs), that are used to specifically tag unique samples in a sequencing run. Sequence should be reported in uppercase letters

fields.name: adapters
fields.description: Adapters provide priming sequences for both amplification and sequencing of the sample-library fragments. Both adapters should be reported; in uppercase letters

fields.name: pcr conditions
fields.description: Description of reaction conditions and components for PCR in the form of 'initial denaturation:94degC_1.5min; annealing=...'

fields.name: sequencing method
fields.description: Sequencing machine used. Where possible the term should be taken from the OBI list of DNA sequencers (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/OBI_0400103).

fields.name: sequence quality check
fields.description: Indicate if the sequence has been called by automatic systems (none) or undergone a manual editing procedure (e.g. by inspecting the raw data or chromatograms). Applied only for sequences that are not submitted to SRA or DRA

fields.name: chimera check software
fields.description: Tool(s) used for chimera checking, including version number and parameters, to discover and remove chimeric sequences. A chimeric sequence is comprised of two or more phylogenetically distinct parent sequences.

fields.name: relevant electronic resources
fields.description: A related resource that is referenced, cited, or otherwise associated to the sequence in the format of a PMID, DOI or URL

fields.name: relevant standard operating procedures
fields.description: Standard operating procedures used in assembly and/or annotation of genomes, metagenomes or environmental sequences in the format of a PMID, DOI or URL

fields.name: negative control type
fields.description: The substance or equipment used as a negative control in an investigation

fields.name: positive control type
fields.description: The substance, mixture, product, or apparatus used to verify that a process which is part of an investigation delivers a true positive.

fields.name: collection date
fields.description: The date the sample was collected with the intention of sequencing, either as an instance (single point in time) or interval. In case no exact time is available, the date/time can be right truncated i.e. all of these are valid ISO8601 compliant times: 2008-01-23T19:23:10+00:00; 2008-01-23T19:23:10; 2008-01-23; 2008-01; 2008.
fields.regex: (^[12][0-9]{3}(-(0[1-9]|1[0-2])(-(0[1-9]|[12][0-9]|3[01])(T[0-9]{2}:[0-9]{2}(:[0-9]{2})?Z?([+-][0-9]{1,2})?)?)?)?(/[0-9]{4}(-[0-9]{2}(-[0-9]{2}(T[0-9]{2}:[0-9]{2}(:[0-9]{2})?Z?([+-][0-9]{1,2})?)?)?)?)?$)|(^not collected$)|(^not provided$)|(^restricted access$)|(^missing: control sample$)|(^missing: sample group$)|(^missing: synthetic construct$)|(^missing: lab stock$)|(^missing: third party data$)|(^missing: data agreement established pre-2023$)|(^missing: endangered species$)|(^missing: human-identifiable$)

fields.name: altitude
fields.description: The altitude of the sample is the vertical distance between Earth's surface above Sea Level and the sampled position in the air.

fields.name: geographic location (country and/or sea)
fields.description: The location the sample was collected from with the intention of sequencing, as defined by the country or sea. Country or sea names should be chosen from the INSDC country list (http://insdc.org/country.html).
cv: South Georgia and the South Sandwich Islands

fields.name: geographic location (latitude)
fields.description: The geographical origin of the sample as defined by latitude. The values should be reported in decimal degrees and in WGS84 system
fields.regex: (^[+-]?[0-9]+.?[0-9]{0,8}$)|(^not collected$)|(^not provided$)|(^restricted access$)|(^missing: control sample$)|(^missing: sample group$)|(^missing: synthetic construct$)|(^missing: lab stock$)|(^missing: third party data$)|(^missing: data agreement established pre-2023$)|(^missing: endangered species$)|(^missing: human-identifiable$)

fields.name: geographic location (longitude)
fields.description: The geographical origin of the sample as defined by longitude. The values should be reported in decimal degrees and in WGS84 system
fields.regex: (^[+-]?[0-9]+.?[0-9]{0,8}$)|(^not collected$)|(^not provided$)|(^restricted access$)|(^missing: control sample$)|(^missing: sample group$)|(^missing: synthetic construct$)|(^missing: lab stock$)|(^missing: third party data$)|(^missing: data agreement established pre-2023$)|(^missing: endangered species$)|(^missing: human-identifiable$)

fields.name: geographic location (region and locality)
fields.description: The geographical origin of the sample as defined by the specific region name followed by the locality name.

fields.name: depth
fields.description: The vertical distance below local surface, e.g. for sediment or soil samples depth is measured from sediment or soil surface, respectively. Depth can be reported as an interval for subsurface samples.

fields.name: broad-scale environmental context
fields.description: Report the major environmental system the sample or specimen came from. The system(s) identified should have a coarse spatial grain, to provide the general environmental context of where the sampling was done (e.g. in the desert or a rainforest). We recommend using subclasses of EnvO’s biome class: http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/ENVO_00000428. EnvO documentation about how to use the field: https://github.com/EnvironmentOntology/envo/wiki/Using-ENVO-with-MIxS.

fields.name: local environmental context
fields.description: Report the entity or entities which are in the sample or specimen’s local vicinity and which you believe have significant causal influences on your sample or specimen. We recommend using EnvO terms which are of smaller spatial grain than your entry for "broad-scale environmental context". Terms, such as anatomical sites, from other OBO Library ontologies which interoperate with EnvO (e.g. UBERON) are accepted in this field. EnvO documentation about how to use the field: https://github.com/EnvironmentOntology/envo/wiki/Using-ENVO-with-MIxS.

fields.name: environmental medium
fields.description: Report the environmental material(s) immediately surrounding the sample or specimen at the time of sampling. We recommend using subclasses of 'environmental material' (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/ENVO_00010483). EnvO documentation about how to use the field: https://github.com/EnvironmentOntology/envo/wiki/Using-ENVO-with-MIxS . Terms from other OBO ontologies are permissible as long as they reference mass/volume nouns (e.g. air, water, blood) and not discrete, countable entities (e.g. a tree, a leaf, a table top).

fields.name: elevation
fields.description: The elevation of the sampling site as measured by the vertical distance from mean sea level.

fields.name: source material identifiers
fields.description: A unique identifier assigned to a material sample (as defined by http://rs.tdwg.org/dwc/terms/materialSampleID, and as opposed to a particular digital record of a material sample) used for extracting nucleic acids, and subsequent sequencing. The identifier can refer either to the original material collected or to any derived sub-samples. The INSDC qualifiers /specimen_voucher, /bio_material, or /culture_collection may or may not share the same value as the source_mat_id field. For instance, the /specimen_voucher qualifier and source_mat_id may both contain 'UAM:Herps:14' , referring to both the specimen voucher and sampled tissue with the same identifier. However, the /culture_collection qualifier may refer to a value from an initial culture (e.g. ATCC:11775) while source_mat_id would refer to an identifier from some derived culture from which the nucleic acids were extracted (e.g. xatc123 or ark:/2154/R2).

fields.name: sample material processing
fields.description: A brief description of any processing applied to the sample during or after retrieving the sample from environment, or a link to the relevant protocol(s) performed.

fields.name: isolation and growth condition
fields.description: Publication reference in the form of pubmed ID (pmid), digital object identifier (doi) or url for isolation and growth condition specifications of the organism/material. Mandatory for MIGS and MIMARKS Specimen.

fields.name: propagation
fields.description: The type of reproduction from the parent stock. Values for this field is specific to different taxa. For phage or virus: lytic/lysogenic/temperate/obligately lytic. For plasmids: incompatibility group. For eukaryotes: sexual/asexual. Mandatory for MIGs of eukayotes, plasmids and viruses.

fields.name: amount or size of sample collected
fields.description: The total amount or size (volume (ml), mass (g) or area (m2) ) of sample collected.

fields.name: biomass
fields.description: amount of biomass; should include the name for the part of biomass measured, e.g. microbial, total. can include multiple measurements

fields.name: oxygenation status of sample
fields.description: oxygenation status of sample

fields.name: organism count
fields.description: Total cell count of any organism (or group of organisms) per gram, volume or area of sample, should include name of organism followed by count. The method that was used for the enumeration (e.g. qPCR, atp, mpn, etc.) Should also be provided. (example: total prokaryotes; 3.5e7 cells per ml; qpcr)

fields.name: sample storage duration
fields.description: duration for which sample was stored

fields.name: sample storage temperature
fields.description: temperature at which sample was stored, e.g. -80

fields.name: sample storage location
fields.description: location at which sample was stored, usually name of a specific freezer/room

fields.name: sample collection device
fields.description: The device used to collect an environmental sample. It is recommended to use terms listed under environmental sampling device (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/ENVO) and/or terms listed under specimen collection device (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/GENEPIO_0002094).

fields.name: sample collection method
fields.description: The method employed for collecting the sample. Can be provided in the form of a PMID, DOI, url or text.

fields.name: host disease status
fields.description: list of diseases with which the host has been diagnosed; can include multiple diagnoses. The value of the field depends on host; for humans the terms should be chosen from DO (Disease Ontology) at http://www.disease-ontology.org, other hosts are free text

fields.name: host scientific name
fields.description: Scientific name of the natural (as opposed to laboratory) host to the organism from which sample was obtained.

fields.name: alkalinity
fields.description: alkalinity, the ability of a solution to neutralize acids to the equivalence point of carbonate or bicarbonate

fields.name: mean friction velocity
fields.description: measurement of mean friction velocity

fields.name: mean peak friction velocity
fields.description: measurement of mean peak friction velocity

fields.name: pressure
fields.description: pressure to which the sample is subject, in atmospheres

fields.name: temperature
fields.description: temperature of the sample at time of sampling

fields.name: turbidity
fields.description: turbidity measurement

fields.name: pH
fields.description: pH measurement

fields.name: alkyl diethers
fields.description: concentration of alkyl diethers

fields.name: aminopeptidase activity
fields.description: measurement of aminopeptidase activity

fields.name: ammonium
fields.description: concentration of ammonium

fields.name: bacterial carbon production
fields.description: measurement of bacterial carbon production

fields.name: bishomohopanol
fields.description: concentration of bishomohopanol

fields.name: bromide
fields.description: concentration of bromide

fields.name: calcium
fields.description: concentration of calcium

fields.name: carbon/nitrogen ratio
fields.description: ratio of amount or concentrations of carbon to nitrogen

fields.name: chloride
fields.description: concentration of chloride

fields.name: chlorophyll
fields.description: concentration of chlorophyll

fields.name: diether lipids
fields.description: concentration of diether lipids; can include multiple types of diether lipids

fields.name: dissolved carbon dioxide
fields.description: concentration of dissolved carbon dioxide

fields.name: dissolved hydrogen
fields.description: concentration of dissolved hydrogen

fields.name: dissolved inorganic carbon
fields.description: dissolved inorganic carbon concentration

fields.name: dissolved organic carbon
fields.description: concentration of dissolved organic carbon

fields.name: dissolved organic nitrogen
fields.description: dissolved organic nitrogen concentration measured as; total dissolved nitrogen - NH4 - NO3 - NO2

fields.name: methane
fields.description: methane (gas) amount or concentration at the time of sampling

fields.name: dissolved oxygen
fields.description: concentration of dissolved oxygen

fields.name: glucosidase activity
fields.description: measurement of glucosidase activity

fields.name: magnesium
fields.description: concentration of magnesium

fields.name: n-alkanes
fields.description: concentration of n-alkanes; can include multiple n-alkanes

fields.name: nitrate
fields.description: concentration of nitrate

fields.name: nitrite
fields.description: concentration of nitrite

fields.name: nitrogen
fields.description: concentration of nitrogen (total)

fields.name: organic carbon
fields.description: concentration of organic carbon

fields.name: organic matter
fields.description: concentration of organic matter

fields.name: organic nitrogen
fields.description: concentration of organic nitrogen

fields.name: particulate organic carbon
fields.description: concentration of particulate organic carbon

fields.name: petroleum hydrocarbon
fields.description: concentration of petroleum hydrocarbon

fields.name: phaeopigments
fields.description: concentration of phaeopigments; can include multiple phaeopigments

fields.name: phosphate
fields.description: concentration of phosphate

fields.name: phospholipid fatty acid
fields.description: concentration of phospholipid fatty acids; can include multiple values

fields.name: potassium
fields.description: concentration of potassium

fields.name: redox potential
fields.description: redox potential, measured relative to a hydrogen cell, indicating oxidation or reduction potential

fields.name: salinity
fields.description: The total concentration of all dissolved salts in a liquid or solid sample. While salinity can be measured by a complete chemical analysis, this method is difficult and time consuming. More often, it is instead derived from the conductivity measurement. This is known as practical salinity. These derivations compare the specific conductance of the sample to a salinity standard such as seawater.

fields.name: total carbon
fields.description: total carbon content

fields.name: silicate
fields.description: concentration of silicate

fields.name: sodium
fields.description: sodium concentration

fields.name: total organic carbon
fields.description: Definition for soil: total organic C content of the soil units of g C/kg soil. Definition otherwise: total organic carbon content

fields.name: water content
fields.description: water content measurement

fields.name: sulfate
fields.description: concentration of sulfate

fields.name: sulfide
fields.description: concentration of sulfide

fields.name: total nitrogen
fields.description: total nitrogen content of the sample

fields.name: subspecific genetic lineage
fields.description: Information about the genetic distinctness of the sequenced organism below the subspecies level, e.g., serovar, serotype, biotype, ecotype, or any relevant genetic typing schemes like Group I plasmid. Subspecies should not be recorded in this term, but in the NCBI taxonomy. Supply both the lineage name and the lineage rank separated by a colon, e.g., biovar:abc123.

fields.name: trophic level
fields.description: Trophic levels are the feeding position in a food chain. Microbes can be a range of producers (e.g. chemolithotroph)

fields.name: relationship to oxygen
fields.description: Is this organism an aerobe, anaerobe? Please note that aerobic and anaerobic are valid descriptors for microbial environments

fields.name: known pathogenicity
fields.description: To what is the entity pathogenic, for instance plant, fungi, bacteria

fields.name: encoded traits
fields.description: Should include key traits like antibiotic resistance or xenobiotic degradation phenotypes for plasmids, converting genes for phage

fields.name: observed biotic relationship
fields.description: Is it free-living or in a host and if the latter what type of relationship is observed

fields.name: chemical administration
fields.description: list of chemical compounds administered to the host or site where sampling occurred, and when (e.g. antibiotics, N fertilizer, air filter); can include multiple compounds. For Chemical Entities of Biological Interest ontology (CHEBI) (v111), please see http://purl.bioontology.org/ontology/CHEBI

fields.name: perturbation
fields.description: type of perturbation, e.g. chemical administration, physical disturbance, etc., coupled with time that perturbation occurred; can include multiple perturbation types
